details.description: How to complain about the Pension Service if you're unhappy with the service you’ve received
details.body:
If you’re unhappy with the service you’ve received, contact the office dealing with your claim - their details will be at the top of any letters from the Pension Service.

If you’re not sure which office to contact, call the Pension Service helpline.

Pension Service helpline
Telephone: 08456 060 265
Textphone: 0845 722 4433
Monday to Friday, 8am to 6pm

If you’re abroad, contact the International Pension Centre.

Explain what has happened, how this has affected you and what you want to happen to put things right.

The Pension Service will try to solve your issues over the phone or deal with your complaint within 15 working days.

If you’re unhappy with the response

You’ll be asked if you want your complaint sent to the Chief Operating Officer of the Pension Service, who aims to deal with complaints within 15 working days.

If you’re still unhappy, you can then ask the Independent Case Examiner to investigate - they’ll be impartial and this is free.

If you’re unhappy with the response from the Independent Case Examiner, you can ask your MP to send your complaint to the Parliamentary and Health Service Ombudsman.

If a mistake has been made

You may get a special payment if you’ve experienced unfair treatment or suffered financially.

You can get independent advice from Citizens Advice.
